questions.question_hindi: ऋग्वैदिक कालमें विनिमय के माध्यम के रूप में किसका प्रयोग किया जाता था?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: What was used as a medium of exchange during the Rigvedic period?
questions.explanation_english: During the Rigvedic period, the barter system was prevalent. Cows were considered a primary medium of exchange because they were a valuable asset and could be easily traded. They were used in transactions for goods and services. The use of currency (coins) emerged later in the Indian subcontinent, during the later Vedic period or under different kingdoms. Grain was also used but not as a standardized medium as cows. Slaves existed but were not used as a medium of exchange.
questions.explanation_hindi: ऋग्वैदिक काल में बार्टर प्रणाली आम थी। गायों को एक प्रमुख विनिमय माध्यम माना जाता था क्योंकि वे मूल्यवान संपत्ति थीं और आसानी से व्यापार की जा सकती थीं। वे वस्तुओं और सेवाओं के लिए लेन-देन में उपयोग की जाती थीं। मुद्रा (सिक्के) का उपयोग भारतीय उपमहाद्वीप में बाद के वैदिक काल या अन्य राज्यों में हुआ। अनाज का भी उपयोग किया जाता था लेकिन गायों के रूप में विनिमय माध्यम के रूप में नहीं। दास थे लेकिन वे विनिमय के माध्यम नहीं थे।
key_facts: Cows were the primary medium of exchange in the Rigvedic period due to their value and portability.
The barter system was dominant, and currency (coins) was introduced later in Indian history.

questions.question_hindi: ऋग्वेदमें उल्लिखित क़रीब 25 नदियों में से सर्वाधिक महत्त्वपूर्ण नदी कौन-सी थी?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: Which river was the most important among the approximately 25 rivers mentioned in the Rigveda?
questions.explanation_english: The Rigveda, the oldest of the Vedas, mentions several rivers. The most important among them is the Sindhu (Indus), which was central to the early Vedic civilization. The Ganga is mentioned only once, while the Saraswati is also significant but not as prominent as the Sindhu. The early Vedic civilization was primarily located in the Sapta Sindhu region (seven rivers), with the Indus River being the most revered. Later Vedic texts shifted focus to the Ganga and Yamuna as the civilization expanded eastward.
questions.explanation_hindi: ऋग्वेद में सिंधु नदी का विशेष महत्व है क्योंकि यह प्रारंभिक वैदिक सभ्यता का केंद्र थी। गंगा का उल्लेख केवल एक बार हुआ है। सरस्वती भी महत्वपूर्ण है लेकिन सिंधु जितना प्रमुख नहीं। प्रारंभिक वैदिक सभ्यता साप्त सिंधु क्षेत्र (सात नदियाँ) में थी, जिसमें सिंधु नदी प्रमुख थी। बाद के वैदिक ग्रंथों में गंगा और यमुना का विस्तार हुआ।
key_facts: The Rigveda mentions the Sindhu (Indus) as the most important river in the early Vedic civilization.
The Ganga is referenced only once in the Rigveda, while the focus on the Ganga increased in later Vedic texts.

questions.question_hindi: ऋग्वेदके दसवें मण्डल में किसका उल्लेख पहली बार मिलता है?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: In which of the following is the first mention found in the 10th mandal of the Rigveda?
questions.explanation_english: The 10th mandal of the Rigveda contains the earliest reference to the term 'Shudra' in the Vedic literature. This marks the beginning of the Varna system's codification, where Shudras were designated as the fourth varna. The term 'Chandala' appears in later texts like the Dharma Shastras, while 'Priest' (Purohit) and 'Warrior' (Kshatriya) were already established in earlier Vedic texts.
questions.explanation_hindi: ऋग्वेद के दसवें मण्डल में 'शूद्र' शब्द का पहली बार उल्लेख मिलता है। यह वर्ण व्यवस्था के निर्माण का प्रारंभिक चरण है, जहां शूद्रों को चौथा वर्ण माना गया। 'चाण्डाल' शब्द बाद के धर्मशास्त्रों में पाया जाता है, जबकि 'पुरोहित' और 'योद्धा' पहले ही वैदिक ग्रंथों में उल्लिखित थे।
key_facts: The term 'Shudra' is first mentioned in the 10th mandal of the Rigveda, marking the formalization of the Varna system.
The term 'Chandala' appears in later texts like the Dharma Shastras, not in the Rigveda.

questions.question_hindi: 'आर्य' शब्द का शाब्दिक अर्थ क्या है?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: What is the literal meaning of the word 'Arya'?
questions.explanation_english: The term 'Arya' (आर्य) in Sanskrit is derived from the root word 'ar' meaning 'to nourish' or 'to protect'. It is commonly associated with the concept of nobility, respect, and honor. Among the given options, 'Brave' (वीर) is the closest in meaning as 'Arya' often denotes a person of noble character or high moral standards. The other options do not align with the etymological or historical significance of the term.
questions.explanation_hindi: शब्द 'आर्य' (आर्य) संस्कृत में मूल रूप से 'आर' शब्द से लिया गया है, जिसका अर्थ 'पोषित करना' या 'रक्षा करना' है। इसे नबलता, सम्मान और श्रद्धा के साथ जोड़कर देखा जाता है। दिए गए विकल्पों में, 'वीर' (बहादुर) सबसे निकटता से मेल खाता है क्योंकि 'आर्य' आमतौर पर नौबता चरित्र या उच्च नैतिक मानकों वाले व्यक्ति को दर्शाता है। अन्य विकल्प इस शब्द के व्युत्पत्तिक या ऐतिहासिक महत्व से मेल नहीं खाते।
questions.topic: Ancient Indian History and Sanskrit Etymology
key_facts: The term 'Arya' is used in Vedic literature to denote people of noble character and adherence to Vedic traditions.
The root 'ar' in Sanskrit signifies nourishment and protection, which forms the basis of the term 'Arya' as a noble or respected individual.

questions.question_hindi: बोधगयामें स्थित वह बोधिवृक्ष, जिसके नीचेबुद्धको ज्ञान प्राप्त हुआ था, किस शासक द्वारा कटवा दिया गया?
questions.subject: इतिहास (History)
questions.question_english: The Bodhi Tree in Bodh Gaya, under which Buddha attained enlightenment, was cut down by which ruler?
questions.explanation_english: The Bodhi Tree at Bodh Gaya, where Lord Buddha attained enlightenment, was destroyed by Pushyamitra Shunga, a ruler of the Shunga dynasty. The Shungas were known for their patronage of Hinduism and opposition to Buddhism. Pushyamitra Shunga is historically linked to the destruction of Buddhist sites, including the Bodhi Tree, as part of his efforts to suppress Buddhism and promote Hinduism. Other options like Mihirakula (a Hun ruler) and Mahmud of Ghazni (a Muslim invader) are associated with later periods and different historical contexts. Shashanka, the Gauda king, ruled much later and is not connected to this event.
questions.explanation_hindi: बोधगया में बुद्ध के ज्ञान प्राप्ति के लिए प्रसिद्ध बोधि वृक्ष को काटने वाला शासक पुष्यमित्र शुंग था, जो शुंग वंश का शासक था। शुंग वंश हिंदू धर्म के प्रमुख समर्थक थे और बौद्ध धर्म के विरोधी थे। पुष्यमित्र शुंग बौद्ध धर्म के विरोध में बौद्ध स्थलों के विनाश के लिए जाने जाते हैं। अन्य विकल्प, जैसे मिहिरकुल (हूण शासक) और महमूद गज़नवी (मुस्लिम आक्रमणकारी), बाद के युगों से संबंधित हैं। शशांक, जो गौड़ के शासक थे, इस घटना से जुड़े नहीं हैं।
questions.topic: Ancient Indian History - Buddhist Sites and Rulers
key_facts: Pushyamitra Shunga of the Shunga dynasty destroyed the Bodhi Tree to suppress Buddhism.
The Shungas were Hindu rulers who opposed Buddhist practices and patronized Hinduism.
